Context: Eric Kukucka is an alumnus of George Brown College's Denturism program. He currently serves as the Vice President of Clinical Removable Prosthetics and Design Technology at Aspen Dental. Aspen Dental is a national network of over 1,100 independent dental offices. Kukucka is responsible for the delivery and clinical efficacy of removable prosthetics, overseeing learning and development initiatives for new and mid-career doctors, and helping develop protocols and materials for dental clinicians and technicians around the world. He consults for multinational companies on various topics including digital workflows, material sciences, imaging technology, and innovations to improve the digital ecosystem of removable prosthetics. Kukucka has been instrumental in putting denturism on the global map, being the first denturist in North America to beta test digital dentures with Ivoclar Vivadent and addressing the American College of Prosthodontists at their annual meeting. He constantly pursues excellence in his craft and educates dental practitioners on creating superior dentures through training in a hands-on and virtual environment, mentorship, and day-to-day support. His role also includes digital transformation of dentures across 1,100+ locations, enhancing patient education materials with product and marketing teams, and upskilling lab technicians to improve the quality of their dentures.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/How GBC alum Eric Kukucka is revolutionizing denturism with innovation and drive | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Aspen Dental has on-site labs for dentures at every location.
* They are using digital technology, specifically 3D printing and digital design software, to streamline the denture creation process and improve the patient experience.
* There are opportunities for error in the traditional denture-making process which can be mitigated by up to 75% with digital technology.
* Digital innovation is important but a thorough understanding of analogue fundamentals is also necessary for denturists.
* George Brown College provided Kukucka with a solid foundation in removable prosthodontics and professionalism.
* He hired multiple alumni from the college's Denturism program for his former private practice.
* Without George Brown, Kukucka would not have been successful as a denturist or launched his career with Aspen Dental.
* Kukucka advises current students and aspiring denturists to work hard, continuously improve, be open-minded, listen to experienced professionals, and keep learning.
